Description: Three separate papyrus fragments, with numerous lacunae, possibly joined together for bookbinding. From right to left, fragment 1 preserves part of 5 lines of Coptic, written along the fibres, fragment 2 preserves part of 6 lines written against the fibres, upside down in relation to frags 1 and 3, while fragment 3 preserves the left-hand side of the first 10 lines of a Coptic tithe collection contract (and possibly the lower margin), written against the fibres. EA 75314, 75313, 75312, 75311, 75310, 75309 are mounted together.
Curator's comments: The place of origin was probably the Hermopolite monastery of Apa Apollo; for the typically Hermopolite name, Daurine (Taurine). Few details concerning the tithe collection are preserved in this fragmentary contract; the only item of interest in it is the phrase 'the sick ones'.
Bibliographic references: Clackson 2000 / Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo (p.12, 59-60, pl.6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (86567) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/86567)
